titleStmt.title: Whereas the lords spiritual and temporal, and the knights, citizens and burgesses, members of the Parliament of King Charles the Second ... have desired Us to cause Our letters to be written ...
titleStmt.author: William III, King of England, 1650-1702.

notesStmt.note: Begins at head of text: "My Lord,"
"Given at St. James's the Nine and twentieth Day of December, in the Year of our Lord, 1688."
Form letter calling for election of a new parliament.
Reproduction of original in: Newberry Library.
